title: AI chipmaker Cerebras Systems raises $1 billion, valued at about $23 billion
summary: Cerebras secured a $1B late-stage round that nearly tripled its valuation in just over four months, underscoring the accelerating race to fund AI compute alternatives.
author: Reuters

title: Nvidia AI chip sales to China stalled by U.S. security review, FT reports
summary: Nvidia’s H200 shipments to China remain uncertain as a national security review delays clarity, highlighting ongoing geopolitical risk around AI hardware supply chains.
author: Reuters

title: Anthropic's new AI tools deepen selloff in data analytics and software stocks
summary: Anthropic launched plugins for its Claude Cowork agent targeting legal, sales, marketing and analytics workflows—triggering a sharp market reaction across data/software names.
author: Reuters

title: Project Genie: Infinite, interactive worlds powered by a world model (Genie 3)
summary: DeepMind’s prototype shows real-time, explorable AI-generated worlds — a major step toward interactive simulation, game creation, and embodied-agent training.
author: Google

title: Google to Build Massive Infrastructure Investment in Germany
summary: Google plans its largest-ever investment in Germany including data centres, renewable energy and frontier infrastructure in Munich, Frankfurt and Berlin.
author: Reuters

title: Maia 200: Microsoft’s inference accelerator aimed at shifting the economics of large-scale AI
summary: A hyperscaler’s serious in-house inference silicon — optimized for serving large models — signals the next phase of AI: cost-per-token wars.
author: Microsoft
